result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrone Laveal Goudy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Pay all court costs
Pay DNA surcharges;
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter or Cash Bail to apply
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs and surcharges  be paid within 30 days of incarceration to convert to a civil judgment.

-Provide a DNA sample.

No further violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs.
No contact with 3044 N 12th Street.

Cooperate with the Probation Department.

Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.

AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary.
Random urine screens.

timeConds.notes: 60 days in HOC straight time with credit for 33 days time served.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  1 YEAR at the House of Corrections with 33 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- 60 days in HOC straight time with credit for 33 days time served
- No further violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with the Probation Department
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary
- 50 hours of community service
- No possession of alcohol or illegal drugs
- Random urine screens
- Seek and maintain full-time employment
- no contact with 3044 N 12th Street
- Provide a DNA sample.
Court orders no other specific programming conditions.  Defendant must complete a risk and needs assessment with DOC and comply with case plan goals related to prioritized need areas so identified.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Pay all court costs
Pay DNA surcharges;
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter or Cash Bail to apply
-  If revoked, the Court ordered that all court costs and surcharges  be paid within 30 days of incarceration to convert to a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.


Filed:   
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pretrial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Tyrone Laveal Goudy in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Defendant Tyrone Laveal Goudy in custody.  Thomas Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court orders defendant provide a DNA sample.
Case proceeded to sentencing.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Same bail conditions as previously ordered.

Defendant Tyrone Laveal Goudy in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Thomas L. Potter appeared by tefor the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court addressed the JusticePoint drug violation.  Statements heard from State and defense.  Court set cash bail.
Violation report, received and filed

Defendant Tyrone Laveal Goudy in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Ron Dague appeared for Tom Potter the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk    Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference and jury trial in Branch 19.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Tyrone Laveal Goudy in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Tom Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case recalled.  Court amends the final pretrial date to a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyrone Laveal Goudy in court with attorney Robert Lee Taylor.  Tom Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk
Attorney Taylor appears as new counsel.  Case passed to allow defense more time.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Tyrone Laveal Goudy in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Lockwood informs court that there has been a breakdown in communication that is irreconcilable.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Court ordered the Public Defender Office to attempt to appoit counsel that can proceed to trial on the date previously selected. Attorney is to inform the Public Defender's Office that new counsel needs to be appointed.  Case is adjourned for status of counsel.  All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Status conference scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Motion hearing on July 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
At the request of the defense counsel, and without objection from the court or the state, case calendared for motion hearing on 07/28/2015 at 8:30am.

Defendant Tyrone Laveal Goudy in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Scheduling conference, defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.    All parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Dennis Cimpl, Branch 19, in Room 313 of the Safety Building due to rotation.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 09:00 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Defendant Tyrone Laveal Goudy in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 4/15/15.
css
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with F.M., D.R., and Northside Meat Market.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Tyrone Laveal Goudy in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Tyrone Laveal Goudy in custody.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
